title: How's top lane right now?
body:
I'm trying to learn top lane. I'm mostly a mid player with some bot/support games if I have a duo. Anyway I'd like to know what are the best and worst champs, why, what runes do I use and how do I build for them. Are there any top lane players who stream/have a yt account that you recommend for me to watch? I'm not really confident when it comes to top and I'm not really sure what I'm doing. Any advice would be appreciated.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

nearly anything goes , its the clusterfukassclownfiesta meta

as you see in mid, jungle and bot lane. 

pick champs you think you like, look up runes/items on sites like lolalytics.com for said champ and go play.
You can't rly do that...the devs made some top laners unplayable. To have most fun you need to play the champions that have highest pick rate, or else you'll be at a massive disadvantage...

my point is its all about match up.

no dont pick janna vs camille top

but with in reason if you see teemo top and are good on an ap caster with burst/gap close pick it , thats a good counter to teemo.

donger is viable top dont pick melee bruiser/tank into etc 

its not about whats meta its whats is best match up.
The top lane has a meta. All in or survive all ins. If your champ can't do one of those two things you will be punished top lane.

People who enjoy a challenge more than winning can still play everything.

It's true that not everything is optimal up there, but if you're stubborn enough and are willing to take some losses while you learn you can pretty much make anything work up top.
It's really not a pleasant experience for you OR your team having your face pummeled in by a riven when you try to find out if top ashe works or not.
True, but that is what normal games are for.
Ohh okay I thought there would be a specific meta for top since I've been seeing the same handful of champs recently. And I'll also look up lolalytics, thanks for mentioning it!

annie/viegar is actually viable top in the right match up/team comp

top is heavy bruiser/fighter in general right now, tanks arent good in meta

garen is a easy champ to learn who is currently strong, darius, jax is decent, camille , irelia,
I've been thinking of eventually trying Darius and Camille. I've seen a few friends play them a few times. Seemed pretty fun imo.
garen is the most easy to learn, then darius then camille , i feel she has the best kit but most skill cap

Top lane is dominated by champs with a shit load of mobility, stun/slows or both. You usually need the mobility to have any shot at escaping ganks in the long lane.

> I'm not really confident when it comes to top and I'm not really sure what I'm doing. Any advice would be appreciated.

Well here's your problem.  Confidence is at least two thirds of the top lane experience.  If your opponent senses weakness they will try to capitalize on it.

What sort of champions do you play mid lane?  I can make some recommendations to ease you into the lane, but I need to know what you're used to playing first.  Top lane is kind of the wild west of the map, and most things can work there if you're willing to learn.  The problem is so many things work there that every once in a while someone surprises you with something you didn't expect, but that's part of why I like the lane.

I don't know many youtubers and streamers, but if I had to recommend anyone it would be Gbay99.  He's a top laner forged in the fires of seasons 1-3, and it really shows in his style of play.
My champion pool for mid is Vel'koz, Lux, Annie, Veigar, and Malz. I also play Ahri and Ziggs but I'm pretty inconsistent with them so I'm not sure if I should include them or not...

Honestly, take a higher than average defensive build on Annie and try it top lane.  She has the tools to survive up there, depending on the matchup, and can at least teach you the basics of the lane.  Malz actually has a decent win rate up there, but doesn't have that on demand stun to help keep him safe, so I'd say start with Annie and move into Malz once you feel more comfortable.

Swain, Karthus, and even Heimerdinger are all decent top lane mages right now in case you're interested in any of them.
I've been considering trying Swain up top so that's definitely an option. I'll go for Annie first and see how it plays out. Thank you for the advice :D
Good luck!  And remember to act confident!

if you're a nervous player, Ornn is a great top-laner for passive play. He has a lot of ways to stop aggression, and buying in lane can maker sure you get your farm, then he's a late-game initiation monster. Max that Q first and hit your skill shots <3
I'll keep that in mind and look for Ornn guides. Thanks for the suggestion :D

But I guess it's as annoying to deal with bruisers on top lane as dealing with assasins on mid lane?
